content.user_title: Search GitHub Issues, PRs, and Discussions
content.value_statement: Developers waste hours scrolling through GitHub repositories trying to find relevant issues or solutions. This skill provides structured search strategies, syntax examples, and workflow guides to quickly locate issues, pull requests, discussions, and code examples across any repository.
actual_capabilities: Search GitHub issues by keywords, labels, and date ranges
Find pull requests with specific implementation patterns
Locate GitHub discussions for design rationale and solutions
Search code examples within repositories using advanced operators
Apply search strategies: start broad then narrow results
Research common dependency repositories like whisper.cpp, NAudio, and WPF
limitations: Does not execute GitHub API calls directly
Does not provide real-time search results
Does not access private repositories or authenticated content
Provides guidance only - users must perform actual searches

use_cases.title: Research Dependency Issues
use_cases.description: Look up known issues and solutions for external dependencies like whisper.cpp or NAudio before reporting new bugs.

use_cases.title: Find Similar Bugs
use_cases.description: Search for existing bug reports and their fixes before creating new issue reports to avoid duplicates.

use_cases.title: Discover Implementation Patterns
use_cases.description: Find code examples and best practices from successful pull requests to understand proper implementation approaches.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Issue Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search [owner/repo] for issues about [topic] created after [date]. Look for closed issues with solutions.

prompt_templates.title: PR Code Examples
prompt_templates.prompt: Search [owner/repo] in:code language:[language] for [pattern]. Find pull requests that implemented similar features.

prompt_templates.title: Bug Investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Search [owner/repo] for issues labeled [bug] about [error message]. Check closed issues with most comments.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced Research
prompt_templates.prompt: Search [owner/repo] for [query] AND [constraint]. Use filters: label:[label], is:closed, comments:>5, created:>=2024-01-01.

output_examples.input: Search whisper.cpp for performance optimization issues with quantization
output: Query: Q8_0 quantization OR performance improvement
Expected results: Quantization benchmarks, speed comparisons, optimization tips
Strategy: Start broad, then add specific labels like 'performance' or 'optimization'

best_practices: Start with broad searches, then add filters like labels and date ranges to narrow results
Check closed issues first - solutions are often already documented there
Use is:closed combined with comments:>5 to find well-discussed solutions
anti_patterns: Searching without any filters and expecting relevant results immediately
Only checking open issues - closed issues often contain the solutions you need
Using vague search terms instead of specific error messages or exact phrases

faq.question: What repositories can I search?
faq.answer: Any public GitHub repository. The skill includes examples for popular repos like whisper.cpp, NAudio, WPF, and .NET runtime.

faq.question: Does this skill access private repositories?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides search guidance only. Accessing private repositories requires authentication and is not supported.

faq.question: What search operators are supported?
faq.answer: All standard GitHub search operators: in:title, in:body, label:, is:closed, author:, created:, comments:, language:, and more.

faq.question: How do I find solutions to known bugs?
faq.answer: Search with is:closed filter, sort by most commented, and use labels like 'bug' or 'fixed'. Check PR descriptions for implementation details.

faq.question: Can I search for code examples?
faq.answer: Yes. Use in:code operator with language filter. Example: in:code language:csharp "WaveInEvent".

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub search?
faq.answer: This skill provides proven search strategies, syntax templates, and workflow guides to help you search more effectively.
